content.full_text: Abraham Lincoln to Francis P. Blair Sr. and John C. Rives, 3 November 18351 Your subscriber at this placeJohnCVance,  is dead; and no person takes the paper from this office2
paragraphs: Abraham Lincoln to Francis P. Blair Sr. and John C. Rives, 3 November 18351
Your subscriber at this placeJohnCVance,  is dead; and no person takes the paper from this office2

footnotes.text: 1Abraham Lincoln wrote the entirety of the text, aside from that denoted by a footnote.

2It is likely that Lincoln was referring toThe Globe, a popularDemocraticpolitical newspaper. However, Blair and Rives also published theCongressional Globe, so it is possible he was referring to that less circulated newspaper.
3Lincolnservedas Postmaster at New Salem from May 7, 1833 to May 30, 1836.

4This notation is not in Lincolnâ€™s hand, and it is unlikely that it is related to the
                  content of the letter.
